intro: Goniothalamus peduncularis, commonly known as the pedunculate goniothalamus, is a tropical climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically arranged in clusters. Its fruits are fleshy berries that contain multiple seeds, aiding in seed dispersal by animals. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
